field.name: description
field.value:
Using ColumnType = "StringClob" to avoid truncated text if it gets too long, but schema creation still output nvarchar(255), which is totally wrong and too small. It suppose to use the latest MS SQL standard, nvarchar(max) from MS SQL Server 2005 to future versions.
For your information, ntext has been deprecated in MS SQL Server 2005.
For more explanation: http://yorch.org/2009/05/sql-servers-nvarcharmax-on-castle-activerecord/
Please include in your documentation on using ColumnType = "StringClob" because it was hard to find.

comment.author: kayluhb
comment.text: This still seems to be an issue with the release version of AR 2.0. Has there been any resolution?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: If you set columntype to string, and length to 10,000 will it work?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: That's how NHibernate works. I'm not sure we want to try to override this in some way...

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: * '''Resolution''' set to ''By Design''. * '''Status''' changed from ''Open'' to ''Resolved''.
